availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: A Kentucky farmer. Lived in Hancock County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Elizabeth Ford Smith. Father of Helen Smith, Horace G. Smith, and Lydia Smith. Owned six enslaved persons in 1850 and fourteen in 1860. Member of the Masonic Order at Lewisport Lodge, No. 303 in Lewisport, Kentucky.

bibl.p: Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of Kentucky, at a Grand Annual Communication, in the City of Louisville, Commencing on Monday, the 21st Day of October, 1867 (Frankfort, Ky.: Frankfort Commonwealth, 1867), 226; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 71; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 6; "George Smith," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=90280612&ref=acom) (accessed on April 12, 2017).
